body.p:
To his Excellency
The Governor of Ky

Your petitioner who are all Loyal citizens of Kentucky and Warren County would respectfully represent to your Excellency that James Brown of This county was fined the Sum of Twenty five Dollars at the last August term of the Equity and criminal court for Warren county for Tipling or retailing Spiritous liquors We know Mr Brown is not in the true Sense of the term a tipler of Spirious liquors but was on this ocasion Induced to get a Jug of Whiskey and to carry it to a Sale by some friends

We further State Mr Brown to be a civil Steedy and industrious man of Good morral character but verry poor and has a wife and Seven children dependant on him for Support. Therfor we pray your interposition

Novr. 25" 1863 --
B. Grinsted
Leonard Harris
E. W. Grinsted
Richard H Caplinger
H Y Gardner
Thomas S. Elrod
B C Grubbs
H Grider
P W Potter
Ivy Gardner
Wm M Arnold

Warren Equity & Crim Court
vs
James Brown
Tipling $20 --
21st Dec/ 63
I cannot understand could he assessed The amt does not accord with any law upon the subject of tippling. --
This fine according to law should have been $20 -- it is in excess all above that sum. Remit all except fees & costs which will reduce the penalty to the legal amount or nearly so.
